triana.types.util

Class Journal

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      • java.util.AbstractList<E>
        • java.util.AbstractSequentialList<E>
          • java.util.LinkedList
            • triana.types.util.Journal
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable, java.util.Collection, java.util.Deque, java.util.List, java.util.Queue

    public class Journal
extends java.util.LinkedList
    Journal is a class that accumulates the history of processing on a TrianaType data object. It has a tree-like structure containing the information about the present data set, and how it was created, plus references to Journals of data sets that were used as input in the creation of the present set. Units add information to the Journal when they create the data set and add references to other Journals when they output the set.

    Journal is implemented as a LinkedList. Its first element is a StringVector, and when used with a TrianaType data object this is the StringVector description of the object. The elements after the first are themselves Journals that represent the histories of input data sets.

    Methods are provided for extending the lists, for writing the whole tree to a String for output, and for re-constructing a Journal from a StringVector input.

    See Also:
    TrianaType, Serialized Form

      • addJournal

      • copyMe

        public Journal copyMe()

      • report

        public java.lang.String report(java.lang.String tabbing,
                      int level)
        Returns a String consisting of the contents of the first element of the present Journal and of the first elements of all the Journals in the list, converted to Strings. The String is structured so that the Journals of previous data sets are preceded with a tabbing String (which can be any String, not just \t) to set them apart from the first, or highest-level, Journal. Each level of the tree further from the present Journal gets an extra tabbing String prepended.
        Parameters:
        tabbing - the String that is to be prepended
        level - the number of times that tabbing is prepended
        Returns:
        String the report

      • readReport

        public static Journal readReport(StringVector report,
                 java.lang.String tabbing)
        Reads an input StringVector and creates a Journal. This is the inverse of the previous method: a string written by method report and converted to a StringVector by breaking it on lines will be converted by this method back to the original Journal.
        Parameters:
        report - A report created by method report and converted to a StringVector
        tabbing - the indentation character(s) in the input report
        Returns:
        Journal the reconstructed Journal.
        See Also:
        StringVector
